  "description": "At Harvest Feed &amp; Agro Processing, we specialize in transforming cassava into high-quality, versatile products for both the food and agricultural industries. Our primary offerings include Venus Cassava &quot;edible&quot; starch and Venus cassava offals, catering to diverse sectors such as food manufacturing, livestock feed production, and organic farming.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Laboratory Analyst

Job Location:&nbsp;Ogun
Job type: Full-time

Role Overview


	The Laboratory Analyst will be responsible for conducting routine and advanced quality tests on raw materials, in-process, and finished products to ensure compliance with internal and external quality specifications.


Key Responsibilities


	Carry out laboratory analyses for moisture, ash, starch, protein, and other key parameters.
	Maintain accurate documentation and traceability of test results.
	Calibrate, maintain, and troubleshoot laboratory equipment.
	Implement and uphold Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
	Ensure compliance with NIS, AOAC, and ISO standards.
	Collaborate with Production and Quality Assurance teams to address quality-related issues.
	Contribute to continuous improvement in product quality and process efficiency.


Qualifications &amp; Experience


	B.Sc./HND in Chemistry, Food Science/Technology, Biochemistry, or related discipline.
	3&ndash;5 years of relevant experience as a Laboratory Analyst in a food manufacturing or Agro-processing company.
	Strong understanding of analytical methods and quality systems.
	Excellent attention to detail, documentation, and teamwork skills.
	Proficiency in laboratory instrumentation and data reporting.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a Cover Letter to:&nbsp;hr@hfap.ng&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Laboratory Analyst Job at Harvest Feed & Agro Processing




        
    

        
        At Harvest Feed & Agro Processing, we specialize in transforming cassava into high-quality, versatile products for both the food and agricultural industries. Our primary offerings include Venus Cassava "edible" starch and Venus cassava offals, catering to diverse sectors such as food manufacturing, livestock feed production, and organic farming.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Laboratory Analyst

Job Location: Ogun
Job type: Full-time

Role Overview
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Laboratory Analyst will be responsible for conducting routine and advanced quality tests on raw materials, in-process, and finished products to ensure compliance with internal and external quality specifications.


Key Responsibilities


	Carry out laboratory analyses for moisture, ash, starch, protein, and other key parameters.
	Maintain accurate documentation and traceability of test results.
	Calibrate, maintain, and troubleshoot laboratory equipment.
	Implement and uphold Good Laboratory Practices (GLP) and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs).
	Ensure compliance with NIS, AOAC, and ISO standards.
	Collaborate with Production and Quality Assurance teams to address quality-related issues.
	Contribute to continuous improvement in product quality and process efficiency.


Qualifications & Experience


	B.Sc./HND in Chemistry, Food Science/Technology, Biochemistry, or related discipline.
	3–5 years of relevant experience as a Laboratory Analyst in a food manufacturing or Agro-processing company.
	Strong understanding of analytical methods and quality systems.
	Excellent attention to detail, documentation, and teamwork skills.
	Proficiency in laboratory instrumentation and data reporting.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and a Cover Letter to: hr@hfap.ng using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Cashier Job at ZIM Integrated Shipping Services Limited




        
    

        
        ZIM Integrated Shipping Services Limited - In the fast-changing shipping world, ZIM Integrated Shipping Services has set itself apart as an independent carrier with a fresh, unique approach. ZIM’s strategy as a global niche carrier offers distinctive advantages to customers worldwide. We have created a smart, efficient network that ensures stable, reliable services; and we have made it our mission to focus on the needs of our customers, which stand at the heart of all our decisions.

ZIM operates in select trades, where it has a competitive advantage and where it can provide superior service. In these trades, ZIM is a significant player with a sizable market share. We maintain a flexible partnership approach with other major carriers, and our new line structure is a much-needed alternative to customers concerned about the current alliance-dominated market.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier

Job Location: Lagos
Category: Finance

Description


	Verify incoming payments in internet banking platform.
	Issue receipts to customers once payment has been confirmed.
	Liaise with internal teams for any payment received.
	Provide support during customers account reconciliation.
	Payment of cheques on refunds of container deposits.
	Complete other tasks/duties at the discretion of management.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Diploma in Accounting or relevant discipline
	Between 1-3 years of prior experience in similar capacity
	Strong math and communication skills
	Strong attention to detail
	Proficiency in Microsoft office, including Excel, Word, Power Point, Web-based and email programs.

  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Manager",
  "description": "Tilden Development Limited is a development company that specializes in innovative residential hospitality and commercial developments in Lagos. Our aim is to harness investments in the real estate sector and provide our investors with transparency, quality customer satisfaction, and timely service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Position Overview


	The business development manager will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, forging strategic partnerships, driving revenue growth, and expanding our client base across residential, commercial, or tech-enabled real estate segments.


Key Responsibilities (Duties)
Business Growth &amp; Revenue Generation:


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities, clients, and partnerships to meet company revenue goals.
	Analyze market trends to develop entry strategies and identify untapped segments (e.g., co-living, smart buildings, real estate developers, facility management firms).


Strategic Partnerships:


	Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders in the real estate ecosystem &mdash; developers, landlords, brokers, tech vendors, and enterprise clients.
	Collaborate with partners to co-develop solutions that integrate with the company&rsquo;s technology offerings (e.g., digital listings, property management tools, rental platforms).


Product &amp; Market Alignment:


	Work closely with Product and Marketing teams to provide market feedback and insights that influence roadmap development and positioning strategies.
	Conduct competitor analysis and customer feedback sessions to improve value proposition and client experience.


Sales Reporting / Record keeping:


	Maintain accurate sales and CRM records, track KPIs, and prepare regular reports for leadership.
	Deliver monthly/quarterly sales targets and growth forecasts.


Cross-functional Collaboration:


	Partner with the Marketing team on lead generation campaigns, events, and brand awareness strategies.
	Collaborate with Legal and Finance teams to structure deals and ensure contractual compliance.
	KSA&rsquo;s (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities)
	Strong knowledge of B2B sales.
	Strong understanding of the real estate value chain, including leasing, property management, and tech adoption trends.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Proficiency with CRM tools and Microsoft Office/Google Workspace.
	Ability to work independently in a dynamic, fast paced environment.
	Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.


Academic Qualification (Minimum)


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business, Marketing, Real Estate Management, or a related field (MBA is an added advantage).
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in business development, preferably within Property Tech, real estate, or technology startups.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr2@tildenng.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Business Development Manager Job at Tilden Development Limited




        
    

        
        Tilden Development Limited is a development company that specializes in innovative residential hospitality and commercial developments in Lagos. Our aim is to harness investments in the real estate sector and provide our investors with transparency, quality customer satisfaction, and timely service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Position Overview
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The business development manager will be responsible for identifying new business opportunities, forging strategic partnerships, driving revenue growth, and expanding our client base across residential, commercial, or tech-enabled real estate segments.


Key Responsibilities (Duties)
Business Growth & Revenue Generation:


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities, clients, and partnerships to meet company revenue goals.
	Analyze market trends to develop entry strategies and identify untapped segments (e.g., co-living, smart buildings, real estate developers, facility management firms).


Strategic Partnerships:


	Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders in the real estate ecosystem — developers, landlords, brokers, tech vendors, and enterprise clients.
	Collaborate with partners to co-develop solutions that integrate with the company’s technology offerings (e.g., digital listings, property management tools, rental platforms).


Product & Market Alignment:


	Work closely with Product and Marketing teams to provide market feedback and insights that influence roadmap development and positioning strategies.
	Conduct competitor analysis and customer feedback sessions to improve value proposition and client experience.


Sales Reporting / Record keeping:


	Maintain accurate sales and CRM records, track KPIs, and prepare regular reports for leadership.
	Deliver monthly/quarterly sales targets and growth forecasts.


Cross-functional Collaboration:


	Partner with the Marketing team on lead generation campaigns, events, and brand awareness strategies.
	Collaborate with Legal and Finance teams to structure deals and ensure contractual compliance.
	KSA’s (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities)
	Strong knowledge of B2B sales.
	Strong understanding of the real estate value chain, including leasing, property management, and tech adoption trends.
	Excellent communication, negotiation, and presentation skills.
	Proficiency with CRM tools and Microsoft Office/Google Workspace.
	Ability to work independently in a dynamic, fast paced environment.
	Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.


Academic Qualification (Minimum)


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Real Estate Management, or a related field (MBA is an added advantage).
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in business development, preferably within Property Tech, real estate, or technology startups.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr2@tildenng.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
